rComments: If you have the chance to take a course with Professor Bird, DO IT. He is really funny, kind, and does his best to make boring material interesting. He is easily one of the best profs at UOttawa!

I hated Real estate with that being said it has been very useful. Bird is an ok lecturer he is disorganized and would benefit from a clear structured syllabus or the use of headings. It was hard to follow and recognize when he stopped a section or thought and began a new one. However, he is super nice and funny. Exam is extremely fair.

Excellent Professor, funny and gives great anecdotes. Makes Real Estate very interesting and exam is very fair. You will learn a lot of and he will prep you well. Don't think twice, highly respected and hilarious!
Clearly explains the material and gives funny practical examples. Doesn't stray too far from the readings. Exam had no surprises. Overall an enjoyable class.
Best prof, really understanding and hilarious.

I have taken Professor Bird's Introduction to Real Estate course and his Advanced Real Estate course. He is one of the most underrated professors at the University of Ottawa. His practical and direct approach prepare you for the bar exam and the real world. A real pleasure. Would highly recommend. It doesn't hurt that he is genuinely hilarious!!
Professor Bird was one of the best profs I have had at the university so far - straightforward and fair exam even though its closed book.

Professor Bird is by far the best professor I have had during my law school career. Not only are his classes practical for both practice and the bar exam, he is as real as it gets. Professor Bird treats his students like colleagues and teaches you as such. It also helps that his stories are really funny.

Professor Bird is one of the best professor's I have met! He is very knowledgeable, makes an effort to make real estate law interesting, is always ready to answer my numerous questions in and outside class and is a fair marker. This course will help you in the bar exam as well.   I would highly recommend taking his class!!!!

Professor Bird is a prime example of why the University of Ottawa should hire more practitioners to teach law courses. He teaches students what they need to know to practice real estate law when they leave law school, while providing useful (and hilarious) examples that keep the class interesting. Gold star for this guy!

Professor Bird creates a terrific class atmosphere. He balances dry humour with academic rigour, which makes his lectures enjoyable. He is also tremendously patient and clear when explaining topics we need to know for the Bar. He distills key points from dense information and communicates them effectively. The best professor at uOttawa by far! :)

Prof Bird is a great professor. I really learned a lot in his class. I feel very comfortable in the area of real estate law from taking his real estate law class. I very much enjoyed the fact that he provides real work examples of what you need to know in the real world if you want to work in real estate law or prepare for bar exam.

Prof Bird is an excellent professor. I was very grateful to have him as my real estate professor. He brings in real world examples to really help his students understand the material. He is very approachabl and provides great feedback if you have any questions. I look forward to taking another class with him, as I really learned a lot in his class.

I really enjoyed taking real estate law with prof Bird. I really learned a lot in his class. He is very friendly and helpful if ever you need assistance. He teaches you what you need to know to become a successful real estate lawyer.  I am very happy to have taken my class with him, and I would highly recommend him to anyone. He's also hilarious.

Prof Bird is a great professor! He was always well prepared and provides great feedback when you seek clarification. I really learned a lot in his class .He really cares about the success of his students. He is a great lecturer w/great humor. He focuses on real world examples and provides great insight of how real estate law is actually practiced.
Good guy, but he is probably overstretching himself with law practice and teaching. Doesn't seem like he prepares for lectures and is content to read verbatim from the textbook.
Learned a lot in this class!

Good professor overall. He sometimes makes concepts more confusing than the textbook, but tends to emphasize the parts of material he will focus on for the exam, so he's fair. Also very approachable and nice when students ask questions.

Prof is an ineffective lecturer. Reads verbatim from text. Student expectations for the exam were unclear. Exam was unfair because he gave students the option of answering  knowledge based questions or a fact pattern with limited facts.  Student who answered the former did well. Provides no feedback on exam. Unprofessional and defensive in person.

He is a really good guy but do not take his laid back and easy going attitude for granted. Do the readings, take proper notes and study like you would in any other course and you will get a decent mark. He is extremely approachable, returns emails and has a good sense of humour.

Had no idea how to teach, opens the book and goes page by page off the reading and throws out a comment or 2...90% of class he spends talking about his previous cases.. worst part, Makes you think the exam will be easy until you get your mark back and have no idea how you received that grade.. I would avoid unless you enjoy absolute uncertainty.

This is the first time that Professor Bird taught the course. At times he was not fully prepared for the lecture and he delivered one dud on construction liens. However, other lectures he was passable. He should improve, a good guy & approachable.
